message.content:
Perfect! Now I can see the specific review comments from Gemini Code Assist. There are two main issues to address:

1. **Frontend performance**: The current implementation reloads the entire tab after editing a feed, which causes UI flicker. The reviewer suggests enhancing the backend to return full feed data including items so the frontend can update just the single widget.

2. **CSS redundancy**: There's redundant CSS for the delete button that should be cleaned up.

Let me address these issues:

function.arguments: {"command": "plan", "task_list": [{"id": "TASK-14", "description": "Enhance backend PUT endpoint to return full feed data including items", "status": "todo"}, {"id": "TASK-15", "description": "Update frontend to update single widget instead of reloading entire tab", "status": "todo"}, {"id": "TASK-16", "description": "Clean up redundant CSS for delete button", "status": "todo"}, {"id": "TASK-17", "description": "Test the improved edit functionality", "status": "todo"}]}
function.name: task_tracker
